data.text:
#royal #flashback Oct 31, 2018 - “Lionel was here the day before yesterday for a bit, & I have seen him two or three times in the last few days.” – a letter from Maurice to his father, 24 May 1915.
 
The Duchess of Cambridge views several documents relating to her relatives. https://t.co/C8er81lTjs

”The King realises that this is the third beloved son you have given to your Country’s cause, and His Majesty trusts that you may be granted strength and comfort in the further sorrow which you have been called upon to bear.” https://t.co/fb8XUA8AZi

Lt. Lionel Martineau Lupton studied at Trinity College and then fought alongside Albert Spencer, the 7th Earl Spencer, who survived the war. 
Lieutenant Lupton had already been wounded and recovered when he was killed at the Somme on July 16, 1916.

In their memory, their father transformed the family home, Rockland, to an institution for the children of sailors and soldiers. He also contributed financially to many causes and institutions. (Michael Reed) https://t.co/9XuisZuGxf
"From whizzing around Cambridge in a Rolls Royce, studying at Trinity College, to losing their lives a mere four years later – the spoils of war altered family life forever.
